docs.lead_paragraph: Update | 7:40 p.m. After eight decades as one of the Continent's biggest automakers, a hobbled General Motors is preparing to bid farewell to Opel and the rest of its operations in Europe, The New York Times's Carter Dougherty and Nelson D. Schwartz report.

headline.main: Berlin Considers a Buyer for G.M. European Unit

docs.abstract: After eight decades as one of the Continent's biggest automakers, a hobbled General Motors prepared Wednesday to bid farewell to Opel and the rest of its operations in Europe.
docs.snippet: After eight decades as one of the Continent's biggest automakers, a hobbled General Motors prepared Wednesday to bid farewell to Opel and the rest of its operations in Europe.

docs.lead_paragraph: Investors eagerly looking for the green shoots of a recovery lapped up the news when Prudential Financial announced this month that it was profitable again, after six months of big losses.

headline.main: On Paper, Prudential Gets a Lift

docs.abstract: Prudential Financial's stock surged after news of its first-quarter profit. But it was largely overlooked that the profit came solely from an accounting change.
docs.snippet: Prudential Financial's stock surged after news of its first-quarter profit. But it was largely overlooked that the profit came solely from an accounting change.

docs.lead_paragraph: Antitrust lawyers say doctors, hospitals, insurance companies and drug makers will run legal risks if they get together and agree on a strategy to hold down prices.

docs.snippet: Antitrust lawyers say doctors, hospitals, insurance companies and drug makers will run legal risks if they get together and agree on a strategy to hold down prices.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new analysis by the New York City comptroller's office has concluded that the state's economy would gain up to $210 million over the next three years if same-sex marriage becomes legal.

headline.main: Would Gay Marriage Help the State Economy?

docs.abstract: The state's economy would gain up to $210 million over the next three years if same-sex marriage becomes legal in New York, a new report said.
docs.snippet: The state's economy would gain up to $210 million over the next three years if same-sex marriage becomes legal in New York, a new report said.

docs.lead_paragraph: After Deadline examines questions of grammar, usage and style encountered by writers and editors of The Times.
docs.abstract: After Deadline examines questions of grammar, usage and style encountered by writers and editors of The Times. It is adapted from a weekly newsroom critique overseen by Philip B.
